question: Flashes of white light when my eyes are closed - retinal detachment or melonoma?
question_content: hi, i have read alot about flashes and possible retinal tears and detachments (which i seriously hope is not the case with me!) but sometimes when im laying down to go to sleep with my eyes shut, i see a bright camera flash which then fades. After reading of the possible causes i then am worried to sleep fearing i will wake up with no vision! Please help me, i dont see these flashes in the day as far as i know. Ive heard the theory that it is your eyes releasing light if they have taken in alot over the day? it happened last night for the first time in a few weeks and i had spent the whole morning inside in the dark and then when i went outside, the harsh sunlight was affecting my eyes, but soon they were back to normal. I also spent a good 5 hours (9pm-2am) on the computer. could this be the cause? I have had floaters in my eyes for a good while and so i think they are unrelated. Also, the reason i mention melonoma is because i am blue eyed, fair skinned, from north europe and recently had sun burn. (can you tell im a hypoconriac? haha) Thanks for your answers

answers.answer_content: It could just be Hypnagogia. Which is pretty normal.

i read somewhere that its the floater striking the back of you eye, i have them all the time, i grew up here in florida never wore sunglasses and have my share of vitrious floaters, mine are chronic,i also have developed a cataract in my left eye, i doubt seriously its a melnoma or a retinal detachment, but all it takes is a visit to an opthomologist for an eye exam, if you have health insurance it all proabably cover most of, it, take care of your eyes i didnt, i regret it, even an optometerist at wallmart can do a dialation and look see, if its bad he will refer you to an eye doc, in my county the health department has a free eye exam, do a little research and STOP worrying, at your age its nothing!oh im hazel eyed and from scottish decent, used to burn like in two seconds here in florida, good luck, dont worry
